Question 40.Question: Please describe any differences in how it impacted your learning (comparing GenAI and your teacher)?
Question 40.Response:
GenAI feedback is a lot more direct because I am getting it to mark my work against the rubric therefore it is very straightforward. This means I can directly change writing before I submit an assignment which the GenAI thinks is unclear etc. 
teacher feedback always comes after submission unless there is an essay plan assignment. Otherwise it requires booking an appointment with a teacher to get feedback before the due date. In this case I would rather skip the hassle of organising a meeting with a teacher if I can get pretty good feedback from GenAI

Question 41.Question: Were there any differences in how the feedback made you feel (comparing GenAI and your teacher)?
Question 41.Response:
Feedback from a teacher sometimes feels biased. I often feel like I have to or have had to write about certain topics depending on who was marking my work. There have been some assessments where I felt the teacher's feedback on an essay (subjective) had been an objective assessment of my work based on their views on the topic. 
GenAI is not biased however I feel like it does generate similar answers regardless of the work. Sometimes making me feel like its not actually reading my work and just giving me a 70-80. However, I find this problem is overcome if I ask for more specific advice about what parts of my essay do not align with the HD bracket of the criteria.

Question 42.Question: Describe any other differences between the feedback you received from GenAI and your teacher.
Question 42.Response: I get similar marks from both AI and teacher grades
